Plot Confidence Intervals for Simulated Compartments

Source: R/model_visualizations.R
plot_simulation_confidence_intervals.Rd

This function generates a time series plot of median simulated values with confidence intervals, supporting different plot types, proportion scaling, and log scaling, with consistent ribbon and line colors.

This function generates a time series plot of median simulated values with confidence intervals, and overlays observed prevalence data as dots with consistent coloring and a clear legend.

This function generates a time series plot of median simulated values with confidence intervals, and overlays observed prevalence data as dots with consistent coloring and a clear legend.

Usage

plot_simulation_confidence_intervals(
  summary_df,
  obs_data = NULL,
  plot_type = "line",
  compartments = NULL,
  plot_proportion = FALSE,
  log_scale = FALSE,
  title = "Confidence Intervals for Simulated Compartments",
  color_palette = "Set2",
  y_label = "Value"
)

plot_simulation_confidence_intervals(
  summary_df,
  obs_data = NULL,
  plot_type = "line",
  compartments = NULL,
  plot_proportion = FALSE,
  log_scale = FALSE,
  title = "Confidence Intervals for Simulated Compartments",
  color_palette = "Set2",
  y_label = "Value"
)

plot_simulation_confidence_intervals(
  summary_df,
  obs_data = NULL,
  plot_type = "line",
  compartments = NULL,
  plot_proportion = FALSE,
  log_scale = FALSE,
  title = "Confidence Intervals for Simulated Compartments",
  color_palette = "Set2",
  y_label = "Value"
)

Arguments

summary_df

A data frame containing summarized simulation results with confidence intervals.

obs_data

A data frame containing observed data with columns date_ymd, prev_A, and prev_C.

plot_type

Character string specifying the type of plot. Options are "line", "stacked", or "facet".

compartments

Optional character vector of compartments to plot (e.g., c("SC", "IC")).

plot_proportion

Logical indicating whether to plot proportions relative to the total population (P column).

log_scale

Logical indicating whether to apply a logarithmic scale to the y-axis.

title

Character string specifying the plot title (default: "Confidence Intervals for Simulated Compartments").

color_palette

Character string specifying the color palette from RColorBrewer (default: "Set2").

y_label

Character string specifying the Y-axis label (default: "Value").

Value

A ggplot object.

A ggplot object.

A ggplot object.

Examples

# Basic line plot
plot_simulation_confidence_intervals(summary_df, plot_type = "line")

# Stacked area plot with selected compartments
plot_simulation_confidence_intervals(summary_df, plot_type = "stacked", compartments = c("SC", "IC"))
#> Error: object 'summary_df' not found

# Faceted plot with proportions and log scale
plot_simulation_confidence_intervals(summary_df, plot_type = "facet", plot_proportion = TRUE, log_scale = TRUE)
#> Error: object 'summary_df' not found
